com.strongloop.android.loopback

Class RestAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.strongloop.android.remoting.adapters.Adapter
      • com.strongloop.android.remoting.adapters.RestAdapter
        • com.strongloop.android.loopback.RestAdapter

  • public class RestAdapter
extends RestAdapter
    An extension to the vanilla RestAdapter to make working with Models easier.

      • createRepository

        public ModelRepository<Model> createRepository(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new ModelRepository representing the named model type.
        Parameters:
        name - The model name.
        Returns:
        A new repository instance.

      • createRepository

        public ModelRepository<Model> createRepository(java.lang.String name,
                                      java.lang.String nameForRestUrl)
        Creates a new ModelRepository representing the named model type.
        Parameters:
        name - The model name.
        nameForRestUrl - The model name to use in REST URL, usually the plural form of `name`.
        Returns:
        A new repository instance.

      • createRepository

        public <T extends Model> ModelRepository<T> createRepository(java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.lang.String nameForRestUrl,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> modelClass)
        Creates a new ModelRepository representing the named model type.
        Parameters:
        name - The model name.
        nameForRestUrl - The model name to use in REST URL, usually the plural form of `name`.
        modelClass - The model class. The class must have a public no-argument constructor.
        Returns:
        A new repository instance.

      • createRepository

        public <U extends RestRepository> U createRepository(java.lang.Class<U> repositoryClass)
        Creates a new ModelRepository from the given subclass.
        Parameters:
        repositoryClass - A subclass of ModelRepository to use. The class must have a public no-argument constructor.
        Returns:
        A new repository instance.
